about_the_game:
A grueling roguelike tactical RPG where combat revolves around YOU!

You are Nrvesk, the ruler of Ruedome. Your reign was bloody, oppressive and unjust. During an inconspicuous strategic meeting with the neighbouring country Stratha, an assassination attempt is made against you. You are seriously wounded yet miraculously carried out of the castle through a backdoor by elite bodyguards.

Your King is your most powerful asset but also your greatest liability. How you control your King will determine whether you survive or perish.

You lose the game if your King dies. That is, if you die!

Protect yourself or face the consequences!



Lost in the Open is designed to be a challenging experience. Enemies will pull you out of position, lure you into traps and work as a team to flank you. Position your units to create an impenetrable frontline, but remember to protect your flanks and, most importantly, your king!





Each node you encounter will offer a narrative choice; do you engage in risky combat or take a small bribe? Do you help a stranger with a chance for a random reward but also a chance to be tricked?

Furthermore, Strathaian royal guards are in constant pursuit. You will need to navigate the world strategically to not fall into the grasp of your pursuers.





Defeating enemies, aiding strangers, and trading with merchants will allow you to unlock new traits and abilities and upgrade your equipment. Flank your enemies with devastating blows, slash through multiple foes at once, or provide your battlefield allies with a powerful buff. You’ll need to forge the recruits you come across into hardened, loyal bodyguards to survive.


    Spend gold collected through battle and exploration to upgrade your troops’ weapons and armor. Gain experience from battles to acquire powerful skills and perks.


    Distribute resources among all units? Or focus and protect a few? Go head-on into all battles or play cautiously, only taking fights you know you can win. At each juncture in the world, you will have half a dozen locations to choose between, so do so wisely!


    Scavenge an abandoned watchtower with pursuers hot on your heels? Take a high-risk battle with the risk of another right afterwards? No outcomes are certain.


    Fight in a frontline formation or spread out. Place your best troops in the center or have them overwhelm the enemy flank. Bait the enemy in and counterattack or take the initiative. Minimize losses by using abilities, status effects, and passive bonuses to your advantage, while keeping the enemy from breaking your line and killing your King!


    You'll be facing a plethora of different enemies: bandits, royal guards, animals, The Deformed and The Righteous. Both enemies and the battlefield itself vary widely - fighting in a claustrophobic forest and a knee-deep swamp are different beasts entirely.

content_descriptors.notes: The game's mature content is almost exclusively its fantasy combat. The level of gore is very limited. Swords, arrows and various weaponry is present and is used but does not generally result in much blood. Story lines are mild, although may contain descriptions of violence, again very mild.

reviews:
“Don't sleep on this promising tactical roguelite.”
Turn Based Lovers

“If you enjoy dark and gloomy atmospheres and are always on the lookout of a new roguelite to enjoy, Lost in the Open is worth paying attention to.”
GameSpace

“We absolutely want to keep an eye on this roguelike”
videogiochitalia
short_description: An unexpected assassination plot leaves you wounded and fleeing across no man's land. To survive in this roguelike, low-fantasy tactical RPG, you must recruit strategically, fight desperately and repent sincerely.
